 As I have said before, I see two problems with this. 
 
 First, we have next to no border security. As I have said before, I try to be a realist, not an idealist, so I recognize that not only do we not have any real border security, we never will. We have too much border and too much coastline to actually believe in border security. It is simply not possible given the expense required. Even if we seal up the US/Mexico border, and the US/Canadian border, we still have thousands of miles of unprotected coast lines. As anybody who has ever entered the country on a private yacht knows, they don't even have to be sneaky. There are thousands of little harbors and ports that you can put into and as long as you are flying a US flag, nobody asks any questions.
 
 I do, however, think that the issue of capital flight is worth addressing. I don't think that we can afford a massive guest worker program just based on the amount of money being shipped back to mexico.
